intro: Cuphea lysimachioides var. dubia, commonly known as the flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, upright stems and broad, ovate leaves with a slightly rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
